name: Analytics
description: Controls: Azure Sentinel Analytics 201-250,Azure Alerts for Network Layer,Azure Network Traffic Analytics

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value:
"Anomalous SSH Login Detection" can identify some suspicious ssh logins potentially indicative of Valid Acct technique. (local)
"Anomalous RDP Login Detections" can identify some suspicious  RDP activity indicative of Valid Account technique (domain and local)
"Login to AWS management console without MFA" can identify potential use of Valid Account technique (cloud acct)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value:
"Anomalous RDP Login Detections" can identify some potentially suspicious use of RDP
"Multiple RDP connections from Single Systems" can identify above-threshold activity of RDP potentially indicative of lateral movement.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic or attempts related to network security group (NSG) for remote services.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect some anomalous RDP activity

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt remote access protocols and groups.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value:
"External User Access Enabled" identifies potentially malicious changes to external domain access specific to Zoom.
"External user added and removed in short timeframe" can detect potential account manipulation technique, specific to Teams.
"New user created and added to the built-in administrator group "  can identify potential attempt to maintain persistence with a new user assigned admin privileges.
"Account added and removed from privileged group" can identify potential attempt to evade defense and escalate privilege.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous access to administrative systems or ports, though can't identify specific sub-techniques/activity.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value:
"Creation of Expensive Computes in Azure" identifies potential resource hijacking.
"Suspicious Resource deployment" can identify potential resource hijacking.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value:
"SSH - Potential Brute Force" can detect potential Brute force password guessing for SSH
"SecurityEvent - Multiple authentication failures followed by success" can identify brute force attempts wrt domain access.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Partial, doesn't cover Password Cracking (done offline typically)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "Sensitive Azure Key Vault Operations" may help identify attacker activity that interfers with backups

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "Sensitive Azure Key Vault operations" may help identify attacker attempting to impact data by deleting private key(s) required to decrypt.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "Sensitive Azure Key Vault operations" may identify attempts to remove account access by deleting keys or deleting entire key vault.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "Users searching for VIP user activity" can identify potentially suspicious Log Analytics queries by users looking for a listing of "VIP" activity.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "New executable via Office FileUploaded Operations" can help identify potential ingress of malicious code and attacker tools to Office services such as Sharepoint and OneDrive (though may generate false positives from normal user exe upload activity)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "suspicious link sharing pattern" can identify potential internal lateral movement via spearphishing (albeit leveraging Zoom not email). Simple threshold rule for specific service, so minimal score. perhaps candidate for new sub-technique of internal spearphishing .

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "Suspicious Resource deployment" can identify potential attacker attempt to maintain persistence or evade defense. by leveraging unused/unmonitored resources.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "Request for single resource on domain" can detect a specific pattern for potential C2 "Beaconing" via web request.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: This control can identify connections to known malicious sites. Partial (arguably minimal) since the malicious sites must be on block list. No sub-techniques scored since not enough fidelity in the alert.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic wrt NSG and application layer protocols

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "Request for single resource on domain" can identify specific pattern for potential C2 beaconing.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: "New Cloud Shell User" identifies new Azure cloud Shell  that could be potential attempts to maintain persistence.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous connections to administrative systems/ports

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value:
"New CloudShell User" can detect potentially suspicious Commandline/shell activity. Candidate for additional sub-technique (Cloud Shell, vs powershell etc)
"Rare and Potentially high-risk Office operations" can identify specific rare mailbox-related account and permission changes.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can analyze network security group (NSG) traffic related to trusted third parties

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic wrt configuration repositories or identified configuration management ports.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic related to one sub-technique (TFTP boot)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous TFTP boot traffic

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous RDP and SSH sessions or blocked attempts.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt specific protocols/ports

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic wrt specific ports (though can't identify presence or lack of encryption)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic wrt specific ports (though can't identify presence or lack of encryption)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic wrt specific ports (though can't identify presence or lack of encryption)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic to and from externally facing systems wrt network security group (NSG) policy

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt remote access protocols and groups.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt remote access protocols and groups.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt remote access protocols and groups.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt remote access protocols and groups.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt remote access protocols and groups.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic wrt critical systems and software deployment ports

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous access to external remote services

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic and discovery attempts to different domains.

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect network service scanning/discovery activity

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify anomalous traffic wrt non-application protocols

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous application protocol traffic wrt network security group (NSG)  (though web traffic would be typically too commonplace for this control to be useful)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous application protocol traffic wrt network security group (NSG)  (though web traffic would be typically too commonplace for this control to be useful)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous application protocol traffic wrt network security group (NSG)  (though web traffic would be typically too commonplace for this control to be useful)

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can identify volumetric attacks and multi-sourced attacks

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic between systems

metadata.name: comment
metadata.value: Can detect anomalous traffic between systems and to external networks.
